document.title: Ohio's Learning Standards Extended-English Language Proficiency

46A662C1FC73435088780FC5F2DD1241.description:
With prompting and support:
• identify a point an author or speaker
makes.

590C0FA4F76F4C5AB69E499950C6171C.description:
With prompting and support:
• identify a main point an author or speaker
makes.
• identify a reason an author or speaker
gives to support a main idea.

D54296BD8F3A4527BDB3E78AAFD6CAFE.description:
With prompting and support:
• retell the main point an author or speaker
makes.
• indicate whether author or speaker’s
main point is supported or not.

E3C842A4A6C54108BD7564F5B1370A1C.description:
An English learner
with significant cognitive disabilities
can analyze and critique the
arguments of others orally and in
writing.

BB22F3F94FDE40D492E952064B564F11.description:
With prompting and support:
• gather information from a few provided
sources.
• label information from provided sources.

D2F85D3FCF0C487A9FE14E3B9B956C6B.description:
With prompting and support:
• gather information from some provided
sources.
• retell information, using illustrations,
diagrams, or other graphics.

9F8A6B3EB8474250BAB49DE2A1754FCE.description:
With prompting and support:
• gather information from several provided
sources paraphrase information in a
short written or oral report.

E9CFEB9E798F473A90EEF8E2E1F0EF7D.description:
An English learner
with significant cognitive disabilities
can conduct research and evaluate
and communicate findings to
answer questions or solve
problems.

A375148928534A94AB61EC7E5474C5EE.description:
With prompting and support:
• participate in short conversations.
• participate in short written exchanges.
• respond to simple questions and some
wh- questions about familiar topics and
texts.

3121E4C7E2C14A8796BEA7A7499BE36C.description:
With prompting and support:
• participate in short conversations.
• participate in short written exchanges.
• respond to questions and wh- questions
about familiar topics and texts.

97F7EDB04C4943FDB351DAADB6C72D86.description:
With prompting and support:
• participate in short conversations, written
exchanges and answer simple questions
• respond to the ideas of others or express
one’s own ideas about familiar topics and
texts.

E9198E697895448F94E1E276121A7230.description:
An English learner
with significant cognitive disabilities
can participate in grade-appropriate
oral and written exchanges of
information, ideas, and analyses,
responding to peer, audience, or
reader comments and questions.

32C3E7D4DE4B40AD90C9EE537ACFD828.description: INTERACTIVE MODALITY: Listening, Speaking, Reading and Writing

E428D29CA38B4D3392E6AC90EDBE97EB.description:
With prompting and support:
• recognize the meaning of some words
learned through conversations, reading
and being read to.

3E616A96E5F34ED5B9D58AFD4B04139C.description:
With prompting and support:
• use language appropriate for a task and
audience.
• use some frequently occurring general
academic and content-specific words and
phrases showing developing control in
speech and writing.

0C13C0B9BE5F4428B315E89CE8B0586C.description:
With prompting and support:
• use language appropriate for a purpose,
task and audience.
• use an increasing number of general
academic and content-specific words and
phrases showing increasing control in
speech and writing.

E7AEB16D5DB447F999B95AF0C8BDF692.description:
An English learner with
significant cognitive disabilities can
adapt language choices to
purpose, task, and audience when
speaking and writing.

1B126DBD868D475EA00B3EB4A11E645E.description:
With prompting and support:
• express an opinion about a familiar topic.

0FA19BCA859B4652BC262B325D3A1572.description:
With prompting and support:
• provide information
• provide one or two reasons or facts to
support the information about a familiar
topic.

55C686E9114D4802B88843FD77094807.description:
With prompting and support:
• provide information
• provide a few reasons or facts to support
the information about a familiar topic.

AC592682BD814DA495B1C495C4F1A2F7.description:
An English learner with
significant cognitive disabilities can
construct grade-appropriate oral
and written claims and support
them with reasoning and evidence.

A6668F61A0AF4AB78FB050F04F1DC476.description:
With prompting and support:
• communicate information about familiar
texts, topics and experiences.

E7F181E1A5694D6893B8C46CBF5C27C6.description:
With prompting and support:
• communicate information
• compose written text about familiar texts,
topics, experiences or events.

E3EF8F2357EF402582A81A988FD38A8A.description:
With prompting and support:
• deliver presentations or information.
• compose written text about familiar texts,
topics, experiences or events.

F764F4D568B045699907260E5BD8520A.description:
An English learner with
significant cognitive disabilities can
speak and write about grade-appropriate complex literary and
informational texts and topics.

F47637A13BC54BE5B2F60362390F2ACE.description:
with prompting and support and relying
heavily on context, visual aids and
communicative experience:
• recognize the meaning of a few
frequently occurring words, phrases and
expressions in texts about familiar topics,
experiences or events

122EFE287DB3460EA41BFC0B2F631AD2.description:
With prompting and support and using
context, visual aids, reference materials and
knowledge of English:
• determine the meaning of general
academic and content-specific words and
frequently occurring expressions in texts
about familiar topics, experiences or
events.

4034FBE3E11946D188DBE77AAEC95B8F.description:
With prompting and support and using
context, increasingly complex visual aids,
reference materials and knowledge of
English:
• determine the meaning of general
academic and content-specific words and
a growing number of expressions in texts
about a variety of topics, experiences or
events.

5FFE598207184AFBB026C2BC0B1F0DF5.description:
An English learner with
significant cognitive disabilities can
determine the meaning of words
and phrases in oral presentations
and literary and informational text.

09205F54697B40C2ADCE55C46C8AD762.description:
With prompting and support, use a very
limited set of strategies to:
• identify a few key words and phrases in
oral communications and simple written
texts.

84555CB3064C48259E00577874420E75.description:
With prompting and support, use an
emerging set of strategies to:
• identify the main topic in oral
presentations and simple written texts.
• retell a few key details from oral
presentations and simple written texts.

2EE7E6B6D87540F8A671ED61CDD38D68.description:
With prompting and support, use an
increasing range of strategies to:
• summarize information from oral
presentations or simple written texts.
• identify two or more central ideas or
themes in oral presentations or simple
written texts.
• identify supporting details and how they
support central ideas or themes in oral
presentations or simple written texts

201246421DC94E4FA9AB67ED8D3CEDE9.description:
An English learner with
significant cognitive disabilities can
construct meaning from oral
presentations and literary and
informational text through grade-appropriate listening, reading, and
viewing.

152F985E877641D6A64766FFD674B7EF.description:
With prompting and support:
• recognize and use a small number of
frequently occurring nouns, noun
phrases, verbs, conjunctions and
prepositions.
• respond to simple questions (e.g., yes or
no, wh- questions).

3B11D06EB09A4BCFA76BE49532B4178A.description:
With prompting and support:
• recognize and use frequently occurring
nouns, verbs, adjectives, adverbs,
prepositions and conjunctions to produce
simple and compound sentences.

FA3EADE142874E6FBDDD422CE2AB5309.description:
With prompting and support:
• recognize and accurately use a variety of
words and phrases.
• recognize and use simple clauses (e.g.,
independent, dependent, relative,
adverbial).
• produce simple, compound and complex
sentences.

8390D25EA6EC46ACBD3FF351F11161D1.description:
An English learner with
significant cognitive disabilities can
make accurate use of standard
English to communicate in grade-appropriate speech and writing.

A712E28DEE3D4EFEBEA361FF33301E35.description:
With prompting and support:
• communicate simple information about
an event or familiar topic.
• use a narrow range of frequently
occurring vocabulary and simple
sentences with limited control.

EB1FDB3EFB1F433F98AE688CCD9F6A4C.description:
With prompting and support:
• communicate simple information about
an event or familiar topic.
• retell a short sequence of events.
• use some frequently occurring linking
and temporal words and some common
transitional words with emerging control.

217CC16293154BEFBB2CD36C16F7863D.description:
With prompting and support:
• communicate a few pieces of information
about a familiar topic.
• retell a sequence of events or steps in a
process.
• use an increasing range of linking and
temporal words and common transitional
words and phrases with increasing
control.

8110FF82BB1D4A66A39BC8D9F9C481F6.description:
An English learner with
significant cognitive disabilities can
create clear and coherent grade-appropriate speech and text.

3D00CAE5642E411092B345DBB8321430.description:
With prompting and support and relying
heavily on context, visual aids and
communicative experience:
• recognize the meaning of a few
frequently occurring words, phrases and
expressions in texts about familiar topics,
experiences or events.

E395060448464F2DACD13B239AF38D26.description:
With prompting and support and using
context, visual aids, reference materials and
knowledge of English:
• determine the meaning of general
academic and content-specific words and
frequently occurring expressions in texts
about familiar topics, experiences or
events.

A3D807E176CA40E2A1AA1BF5B51EE54D.description:
With prompting and support and using
context, increasingly complex visual aids,
reference materials and knowledge of
English:
• determine the meaning of general
academic and content-specific words and
a growing number of expressions in texts
about a variety of topics, experiences or
events.

4952084F53DD44EBA903F5735317EB9D.description:
An English learner with
significant cognitive disabilities can
determine the meaning of words
and phrases in oral presentations
and literary and informational text.

2EFBE562D8E549B99BC07D9F05B2E0A2.description:
With prompting and support:
• recognize the meaning of some words
learned through conversations, reading
and being read to.

8AF4A242EED2457493FEEC1FBBF3C288.description:
With prompting and support:
• use language appropriate for a task and
audience.
• use some frequently occurring general
academic and content-specific words and
phrases showing developing control in
speech and writing.

51CDC5E44D6B4AE69F479B30040029D7.description:
With prompting and support:
• use language appropriate for a purpose,
task and audience.
• use an increasing number of general
academic and content-specific words and
phrases showing increasing control in
speech and writing.

B58D9C8AC82C4241A48714CF45DF24EE.description:
An English learner with
significant cognitive disabilities can
adapt language choices to
purpose, task, and audience when
speaking and writing.

2BBD12E7F7F24F51B84E125B4C18B003.description:
With prompting and support:
• identify a point an author or speaker
makes.

674B3ACA90CD4AB1AE0B94A9B8A18446.description:
With prompting and support:
• identify a main point an author or speaker
makes.
• identify a reason an author or speaker
gives to support a main idea.

9E477435D018450799FEDC881A98257F.description:
With prompting and support:
• retell the main point an author or speaker
makes.
• indicate whether author or speaker’s
main point is supported or not.

AE3370C2BCE14FD7A2D44EC4FE66EEB0.description:
An English learner with
significant cognitive disabilities can
analyze and critique the arguments
of others orally and in writing.

15EB79E5A0B84D3CB8A47F7F37851EBD.description:
With prompting and support:
• gather information from a few provided
sources.
• label information from provided sources.

6A695F29FACD4A2D8B27D77B9B12A5C3.description:
With prompting and support:
• gather information from some provided
sources.
• retell information, using illustrations,
diagrams or other graphics.

455684BF4FD14BEA9047D3440A6A2D63.description:
With prompting and support:
• gather information from several provided
sources paraphrase information in a
short written or oral report.

C27A86B9235E450D9291663404D2E26E.description:
An English learner with
significant cognitive disabilities can
conduct research and evaluate and
communicate findings to answer
questions or solve problems.

593AEB52C8C24E4991181017D707EA0B.description:
With prompting and support:
• express an opinion about a familiar topic.

1097780457564A32AB664A338FE3BF2A.description:
With prompting and support:
• provide information
• provide one or two reasons or facts to
support the information about a familiar
topic.

B815F1B0D2DE466EB17072B7984E9BD5.description:
With prompting and support:
• provide information
• provide a few reasons or facts to support
the information about a familiar topic.

C666DA30E0A440729ACBC911033ADE32.description:
An English learner with
significant cognitive disabilities can
construct grade-appropriate oral
and written claims and support
them with reasoning and evidence.

72C70C216C094143B385E3DCD1DCAEA3.description:
With prompting and support:
• communicate information
• about familiar texts, topics and
experiences.

BDEFD4D0F7204FCD914E177ED7C18A41.description:
With prompting and support:
• communicate information
• compose written text about familiar texts,
topics, experiences or events.

C1326AA794A14FF9B67BB09A47E1A139.description:
With prompting and support:
• deliver presentations or information.
• compose written text
• about familiar texts, topics, experiences
or events.

9182848A377E40CEA67FE3673E2D9E09.description:
An English learner with
significant cognitive disabilities can
speak and write about grade-appropriate complex literary and
informational texts and topics.

1B98BD00A589416D8C0AB58491B418B1.description:
With prompting and support:
• participate in short conversations.
• participate in short written exchanges.
• respond to simple questions and some
wh- questions about familiar topics and
texts.

AEF0C332F35E48C2BFEC5901BCEB10AC.description:
With prompting and support:
• participate in short conversations.
• participate in short written exchanges.
• respond to questions and wh- questions
about familiar topics and texts.

28344D5100514E2380E23B5542EDB5C3.description:
With prompting and support:
• participate in short conversations, written
exchanges and answer simple questions
• respond to the ideas of others or express
one’s own ideas about familiar topics and
texts.

690C3C096D024BD18DF23CA11589A2C5.description:
An English learner with
significant cognitive disabilities can
participate in grade-appropriate oral
and written exchanges of
information, ideas, and analyses,
responding to peer, audience, or
reader comments and questions.

DCFE5BFE3F1845B0B239DEE094AA3F34.description:
With prompting and support, use a very
limited set of strategies to:
• identify a few key words and phrases in
oral communications and simple written
texts.

8C2729FB0EAE425888064BE4CCF0D050.description:
With prompting and support, use an
emerging set of strategies to:
• identify the main topic in oral
presentations and simple written texts.
• retell a few key details from oral
presentations and simple written texts.

1C06ACFEF3264A479359451EFA80743A.description:
With prompting and support, use an
increasing range of strategies to:
• summarize information from oral
presentations or simple written texts.
• identify two or more central ideas or
themes in oral presentations or simple
written texts.
• identify supporting details and how they
support central ideas or themes in oral
presentations or simple written texts.

E9ED5DD4A2CE4FABA82F7F0896AA3DA9.description:
An English learner with
significant cognitive disabilities can
construct meaning from oral
presentations and literary and
informational text through grade-appropriate listening, reading, and
